required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Intra-tumor Injection of Drug-eluting Microspheres for Treatment of Advanced Solid Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To study the safety and clinical effect of injection of drug-eluting microspheres into advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: Assessing side effects and treatment efficacy after injection of drug-eluting microspheres into malignant tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Assessing safety and treatment efficacy on intra-tumor injection of DEB for advanced tumors
primary_outcome.description: Assessing incidence of side effects and primary clinical response of the intra-tumor injection of DEB in advanced solid cancers, including CR, PR, SD, and PD.

arm_group.description: Comparison of tumor diameter one month after injection of drug-eluting microspheres

intervention.intervention_name: Injection of drug-eluting microspheres into malignant tumors
intervention.description: Under the guidance of CT, puncture needle was used to inject drug-eluting microspheres into the tumor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Solid advanced malignant tumors
- Age between18 and 99 years
- Life expectancy is greater than three months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Benign tumor
- Life expectancy is less than three months
- Serious medical comorbidity
- Others

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

facility.name: The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

reference.citation: Borde T, Laage Gaupp F, Geschwind JF, Savic LJ, Miszczuk M, Rexha I, Adam L, Walsh JJ, Huber S, Duncan JS, Peters DC, Sinusas A, Schlachter T, Gebauer B, Hyder F, Coman D, van Breugel JMM, Chapiro J.
